intro: Tithymalus togakusensis, commonly known as the Japanese tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Tithymalus togakusensis thrives in moist, shady environments and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
